abstracts.cdata!:
The project is part of a multi-country
            HIV/AIDS Program in Africa, through which this operation
            aims at strengthening preventive measures so as to slow the
            spread of HIV/AIDS, and at expanding support, and care for
            those infected, or affected by the epidemic. Through a
            multi-sectoral approach, the project objectives will support
            the implementation of Niger's Strategic Framework for
            the Fight against STIs/HIV/AIDS for the period 2002-2007.
            The development objective of both the National Program, and
            this operation are to slow the spread of HIV/AIDS, mitigate
            the adverse impacts of the disease, and, strengthen capacity
            to formulate, manage, implement, monitor and evaluate a
            cost-effective HIV/AIDS program, attained through a
            multi-sectoral approach, drawing on comparative advantages,
            and partnerships among both public, and private entities.
            Within its components, the project will support strategic
            orientations to scale up, expand, and improve prevention
            activities, through the treatment, and care of local
            populations, and activities to mitigate the impoverishment
            effects of the epidemic, as well as strengthen the national
            capacity to implement the multi-sectoral HIV/AIDS program.
            To this end, prevention, care, and mitigation activities
            will be financed through line Ministries, to attain a strong
            health system (that includes tuberculosis prevention, and
            care), through the provision of education, training, and
            improved access to treatment, intensified by the civil
            society response, and community-based initiatives. Capacity
            building and further training activities for the public
            sector, and civil society agencies should foster effective
            management of preventive, and treatment activities. Project
            management activities will support technical assistance,
            program coordination, and administration, and, facilitate
            the multi-country AIDS program's strategic management.
